entry.title: はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - 差異の表示
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズはSAP Analytics CloudのBI機能を使ってダッシュボードやレポートの作成を行う方を対象とし、SAP Analytics CloudのBIにおける基本の操作やTipsをハンズオン形式でご紹介します。

本ブログでは、ストーリーにて予実差異を表示したい！前年度差異をぱっとわかるようにしたい！といった方向けに、以下のようにチャートやテーブルにおいて差異を表示する方法についてご紹介します。

目次：

  • SAP Analytics Cloudにおける差異表示
  • チャートでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］
  • テーブルでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］

※ベースとなるサンプルストーリーの作成手順は、はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityでご紹介しています。

※ SAP Analytics Cloudは、四半期に１度のペースで製品のバージョンアップが実施されます。そのため今後のバージョンアップにより、本ブログで紹介する画面キャプチャや、操作が異なる可能性があることをご了承ください。（本ブログは2025年5月に作成しています。）

SAP Analytics Cloudにおける差異表示

SAP Analytics Cloudにおける差異表示は大きく2種類：チャートでの差異表示とテーブルでの差異計算列の追加による表示があります。

チャートでの差異表示では、複数のバージョン間での差異、または複数の期間における差異を値またはパーセントで表示することができます。差異の表現方法は、チャートによってデータラベルや累積、棒グラフやウォーターフォールなど、見たい形によって使い分けることができます。

【画像】
詳細はヘルプページをご覧ください：チャートに対する差異の追加 | SAP Help Portal

テーブルでの差異計算列の追加による表示では、XXX
【画像】
詳細はヘルプページをご覧ください：（ヘルプリンク）

チャートでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］

0. (リンク)で作成したストーリーを編集モードで開こう！

0.1. ナビゲーションバーのファイルより作成したストーリーを開き、「編集」をクリックします。

1. 数値ポイントのチャートに、前年度との差異を追加しよう！

※2025年Q3より数値ポイントのUIが変わりました。本ブログは変更前の画像になります。

1.1. 数値ポイントチャートをクリックした上、右パネル（ビルダパネル）を開きます。

1.2. （2025年の第2四半期にフィルタをかけます。）「＋フィルタの追加」をクリックします。

1.3. 「Data（メンバー）」をクリックします。

1.4. 「2025」を展開して「Q2」を選択し、「OK」をクリックします。（2025年の第2四半期にフィルタがかかりました。）

1.5. ビルダパネルの「チャートアドオン」を展開し、「差異」をクリックします。

1.6. 「＋バージョン/時間の追加」をクリックします。

1.7. 「Date」を選択します。（今回は前年度差異のためDateを選択しましたが、予実差異の場合はバージョンを選択します。）

1.8. TO (B)の時間にて、「前の時間間隔」の「ｖ」をクリックします。

1.9. 「前年度」を選択します。（これにより、2025Q1との比較から2024Q2との比較に変更されました。）

1.10. 表示オプションの差異の表示形式を「パーセント」に変更し、右下の「処理済み」をクリックします。

1.11. 前年度差異を％で表すチャートが完成しました！

2. 棒チャートに、予算と実績の差異を追加しよう！

 2.1.数値ポイントチャートをクリックした上、右パネル（ビルダパネル）を開きます。

2.2. 色の「＋ディメンション/メジャーの追加」をクリックします。

2.3. 「バージョン」を選択します。

2.4. 「＋バージョンの追加」をクリックし、「Budget」を選択します。（チャートに実績と予算の両方が表示されました。）

2.5.  ビルダパネルの「チャートアドオン」を展開し、「差異」をクリックします。


2.6. 「＋バージョン/時間の追加」をクリックします。

 2.7. 「バージョン」を選択します。

2.8. 表示オプションの差異の表示形式を「パーセント」に変更し、右下の「処理済み」をクリックします。

2.9. 予実差異を％で確認できるチャートが完成しました！
 

 

 

テーブルでの差異の追加方法［ハンズオン］

3. テーブルにXXX

 

今回は差異チャートのご紹介でした。SAP Analytics Cloudは他にも様々な表現や便利な機能があり、本ブログシリーズでご紹介しています。（まとめ）のリンクからご参照ください。

entry.title: SAP分析云中新的表构建体验
entry.content:
随着SAP分析云 2025年第三季度QRC版本的发布，我们很高兴向大家介绍全新的表生成器面板，使表设计流程与统计图和地理可视化对象流程更加一致，简化故事创建。这一新功能已于8月中旬陆续在客户的 SAP 分析云中上线。 

在这篇博客中，我们将重点介绍强调关键的分析增强，这些内容将细分为以下几个部分： 

  1. 虚化表 
  2. 新的生成器面板 
  3. 功能性增强 

对于新的生成器面板中与计划相关的更新,查看Improved Input Readiness and Unbooked Data Display in SAP Analytics Cloud.获取相关内容。 

 

虚化表 

当添加新表或者出现错误状态时，虚化表就会出现。在初始创建时，这会阻止不必要的查询被处理并让设计器选择所需的对象, 确保提供一致且有引导的体验。我们还针对循环依赖、实体缺失等情况，引入了更优的错误处理机制。 

对于SAP BW查询，该表会自动继承基础查询的布局、筛选器和设置。 

 

新的生成器面板 

我们介绍了新的生成器面板，使表构建体验与图表和地理可视化功能体验一致，以下是面板包括的一些增强: 

  1. “可用对象”面板 
  2. 灵活的总计和父节点定位 
  3. 改进的对象选择下拉列表 
  4. 新的成员选择器 
  5. 表加载项 
  6. 表格样式的单一来源 

 

可用对象面板 

新的表格生成器面板引入了打开“可用的对象”的列表选项，从而可以查看数据模型的完整结构和对象，以下是包括一些好处： 

  1. 更流畅、无间断的设计体验，可访问完整的对象列表 
  2. 通过拖放操作或更多操作图标（即“添加到列”或“添加到行”）轻松添加对象 
  3. 通过对象列表中的直观图标，清晰识别维度类型 

 

灵活的总计和父节点定位 

我们已从集中式的“显示总计和父级位置”设置转变为对行和列的独立控制，使设计人员能够更灵活地根据需求定制表格布局。

 

改进的对象选择下拉列表 

我们已优化了主次要结构成员的选择流程。用户现在可以直接从下拉菜单中选择单个成员，而无需使用成员选择器。该菜单已扩展至生成器面板的整个宽度，从而更便于定位和选择所需的成员。 

设计人员可以继续使用成员选择器，对主结构和次结构进行更高级别的成员选择。 

 

新成员选择器的集成 

设计人员在创建本地筛选器或选择主次结构时，现可利用新成员选择器提升效率。当检测到输入控件时，系统将为​​主结构和辅助结构​​显示多标签布局，从而简化元素选择操作。 

此外，​​主结构筛选器（账户或度量）​​ 的功能支持已扩展至非 SAP BW 模型，进一步扩展了其适用性。 

 

表加载项 

通过新增​​专用加载项区域​​（与统计图和地理可视化体验一致），我们显著提升了表格加载项的可发现性，包括​​单元格内统计图​​、​​链接分析​​、​​超链接​​及​​阈值​​等功能。 

同时引入​​专用单元格内统计图面板​​，用户可在此面板内集中配置所有单元格内统计图设置。原位于样式面板的选项（如​​显示数据值​​和​​轴线颜色​​）现移至该新面板，使设计体验更流畅且操作更便捷。 

 

样式相关属性统一展示

自适应列宽​​功能已从生成器面板迁移，​​单位/货币显示​​设置则从数字格式选项移至样式面板下表属性中的中心位置。 

 

功能增强 

通过全新的生成器面板，我们引入了多项功能增强，显著提升了表格可视化的创建与定制效率。具体改进包括: 

  1. 排名与排序优化​​ 
  2. ​​报表至报表接口增强​​ 
  3. ​​混合表改进​​ 
  4. ​​版本维的灵活性 
  5. ​​显示/隐藏阈值提示详情​​ 
  6. ​​分层多选主结构输入控件​​ 
  7. ​​新增客户端计算面板​​ 

 

排名与排序优化​​ 

​​表格的排序和排名功能已全面升级，赋予用户更灵活的操控能力： 

表中的排序不再依赖于版本。当维度同时置于行与列时，用户可自由选择对行或列进行排序，并指定排序依据的维度成员。此外，“保持左列分组”已重命名为“断开分组”，以与统计图术语保持一致。 

对于排名，“创建 Top N”（Create Top N）更名为​​排名​​（Rank），与统计图功能命名统一，支持： 

  1. ​​跨多维度排名 
  2. 对 ​​SAP BW 特性中折叠的层级结构进行排名 

 

报表至报表接口增强​​ 

对于SAP BW 实时连接​​，“jump to”菜单现可支持更多目标类型，包括 ​​Web Dynpro​​、​​ABAP 报表​​及​​自定义 (BAdIs)​​ 

你也可以导航到更广泛的单元格类型（如​​表头单元格​​和​​总计单元格​​）。

 

混合表改进 

混合表功能现在在新的生成器面板中支持，有一些关键的改进： 

  1. 支持排序与排名功能
  2. 支持 ​​SAP BW 数据​​的文本描述格式（​​短文本​​、​​中文本​​、​​长文本​​） 
  3. 应用条件​​功能现可用于 ​​SAP BW 模型​​ 

注意:不支持从经典故事中迁移混合表至优化故事体验，优化故事体验中的混合表格中​​必须至少包含一个关联维度。

版本维的灵活性 

用户现可删除应用于表格的默认的版本筛选器，且无需强制添加一个单值筛选器。此功能为​​计划人员​​提供灵活性，使可视化组件能动态更新以反映单个或多个版本的数据。 

故事设计者需确保表格满足以下至少一项条件以正常显示数据： 

  1. ​​添加版本维度至表格​​（例如置于行或轴）； 
  2. ​​通过单值筛选器限定版本​​（可通过本地筛选器、故事筛选器、页面筛选器或关联分析实现）； 
  3. ​​采用​作用于版本维度的受限制的主结构​​（账户或度量）​​或次要结构​​。 

 

显示/隐藏阈值提示详情​​ 

对于表格中显示的阈值，现提供​​显示/隐藏阈值提示信息详情​​的灵活性选项。此功能允许隐藏阈值​​、阈值名称、范围和条状图信息。 

 

分层多选主结构输入控件​​ 

我们已扩展​​主结构输入控件的功能，支持额外的选择类型：多选、单选层级和多选层级。采用新的成员选择器提供统一的操作体验。表格现支持使用​​多选​​和​​多选层级​​输入控件（除单选和单选层级外），赋予设计者更大灵活性，以构建动态且用户驱动的表格。 

现有输入控件的配置将保持不变。但一旦编辑并确认后，系统会​​自动更新为新输入控件格式​​。 

注意：统计图和地理可视化​​不支持多选或多选层级​​输入控件，若强行使用将导致报错。 

 

新增客户端计算面板​ 

我们推出了​​客户端计算面板​​，帮助设计者轻松管理表中使用的计算项。设计者可通过该面板选择相应操作，快速​​格式化​​、​​编辑​​或​​删除​​计算项。 

本次发布仅是起点。我们将持续改进，使表格更具​​动态性​​、​​交互性​​和​​可定制性​​，突破 SAP分析云在企业决策与洞察分析中的能力边界。一如既往，您的反馈将持续影响产品路线图，我们期待与您共同进化，重塑表格驱动企业级决策与洞察的无限可能。 

敬请期待，更多精彩即将到来！ 

 

SAP分析云新的表构建体验文档 

如需查看新的表生成器当前所有限制，请参考原文中的官方文档 

原文链接：The New Table Building Experience in SAP Analytics... - SAP Community

原作者：Tunir

entry.title: SAP Datasphere & Python : One click to export data of multiple views in Excel/CSV
entry.content:
Introduction

Currently, SAP Datasphere only allows data export through Analytical Models. That means for every fact view, one has to create a separate Analytical Model just to download the data. It’s not ideal, especially when you have many views. Exporting them one by one becomes slow and repetitive.

To solve this,  Python script was developed that connects to SAP Datasphere, runs a query on each view from list, and saves the results as Excel files in a local drive path which is predefined. Now  just run the script, and it exports everything in one go—no manual effort needed.

Requirements 

Before running the script, install the following Python packages:

These packages enable secure connectivity to SAP Datasphere and support efficient data handling.

pip install hdbcli
pip install sqlalchemy
pip install sqlalchemy-hana

Creating a Database User in SAP Datasphere

To enable Python connectivity, create a database user:

  1. Navigate to Space Management in SAP Datasphere
  2. Select the relevant space
  3. Click on Database Access
  4. Create a new user with read access
  5. Copy the host, port, username, and password

Helpful links : Create DB User in Datasphere Space  

Python Script

# 📦 Install required packages (run these in your terminal or notebook)
# pip install hdbcli              # SAP HANA database client
# pip install sqlalchemy          # SQL toolkit and ORM for Python
# pip install sqlalchemy-hana     # SAP HANA dialect for SQLAlchemy

# 📚 Import necessary libraries
import pandas as pd               # For data manipulation and Excel export
from hdbcli import dbapi          # SAP HANA DBAPI for direct connection
import warnings                   # To suppress unnecessary warnings
import os                         # For file path and directory handling

# 🚫 Suppress warnings for cleaner output
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# 🔐 Define SAP Datasphere connection parameters
# 👉 Replace the placeholders below with your actual connection details
db_user = '<your_database_user>'           # User with access to target schema
db_password = '<your_secure_password>'     # Password (handle securely)
db_host = '<your_datasphere_host_url>'     # Host URL (e.g., xyz.hanacloud.ondemand.com)
db_port = 443                               # Default HTTPS port for SAP HANA Cloud
db_schema = '<your_schema_name>'           # Target schema containing views

# 📁 Ensure output folder exists for Excel exports
output_folder = r'C:\Datasphere\Excel export'  # Update path as needed
os.makedirs(output_folder, exist_ok=True)

# 📋 Define list of views to extract data from
# 👉 Add or modify view names based on your schema
view_list = ['VIEW_1', 'VIEW_2']  # Example views

try:
    # 🌐 Establish secure connection to SAP Datasphere
    connection = dbapi.connect(
        address=db_host,
        port=db_port,
        user=db_user,
        password=db_password,
        encrypt=True,
        sslValidateCertificate=True
    )
    print("✅ Connected to SAP Datasphere")

    cursor = connection.cursor()

    # 🔁 Loop through each view and export its data
    for view_name in view_list:
        try:
            # 📊 Construct and execute SQL query
            sql_query = f'SELECT * FROM "{db_schema}"."{view_name}"'
            print(f"📊 Executing query: {sql_query}")
            cursor.execute(sql_query)

            # 📥 Fetch results and convert to DataFrame
            rows = cursor.fetchall()
            columns = [desc[0] for desc in cursor.description]
            df = pd.DataFrame(rows, columns=columns)

            # 📤 Export DataFrame to Excel
            output_path = os.path.join(output_folder, f'{view_name}.xlsx')
            df.to_excel(output_path, index=False)
            print(f"✅ Data from '{view_name}' saved to: {output_path}")

        except dbapi.Error as view_err:
            print(f"❌ Error querying '{view_name}': {view_err}")

except dbapi.Error as db_err:
    print(f"❌ Database error: {db_err}")
except Exception as ex:
    print(f"⚠️ Unexpected error: {ex}")
finally:
    # 🔒 Ensure connection is closed gracefully
    if 'connection' in locals():
        connection.close()
        print("🔒 Connection closed")

Script Capabilities

  • Establishes secure connection to SAP Datasphere
  • Executes queries on each listed view
  • Saves data from each view into a separate Excel file
  • Stores all files in a defined folder

Only connection details and view names need to be updated. The script handles the rest.

 One-Click Execution with a .bat File

To simplify execution, create a  RunExport.bat file to run the Python script with a double-click.

Double-clicking the file will automatically export all views to Excel without opening a terminal

 off
REM Activate Python and run the Export script

REM Change to the script directory
cd /d "C:\Datasphere\Excel export"

REM Run the Python script
python Export.py

REM Pause to keep the window open (optional)
pause

Example

Before Execution 

Double Click on "RunExcel.bat" file

Post Execution

Conclusion
This automation simplifies data exports from SAP Datasphere, especially when working with multiple views.

  • It reduces manual effort
  • improves consistency and saves time.
  • ideal for recurring tasks or scheduled jobs.

For setup support or customization, feel free to connect.

Thanks

Vikas Parmar

SAP Datasphere SAP Business Data Cloud Python

entry.title: How to edit a quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)?
entry.content:
Symptom: You need to edit (increase or reduce) the quota assignment in SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) for SAP Analytics Cloud, SAP Datasphere and SAP Databricks. 

Requirements: You need to have purchased SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC) and have an S-user with the assigned role for Super Administrator or Cloud Administrator in SAP for Me. 

Resolution: 

1. Open SAP for Me and log in.

2. Navigate to the "Dashboards" section and click "Portfolio & Products".

3. Select "Business Data Cloud" in "My Product Suites".

4. Go to "Solutions", pick the tenant (SAC, SAP Datasphere or SAP Databricks) you want to edit the quota assignment, click in the "..." and then "Edit".

5. A new popup will appear. Click "Next". 

6. Update the quota assignment and then click "Next". In this example, we update for SAP Datasphere, but you can change for SAP Analytics Cloud based on number of users and SAP Databricks on capacity units. If you don't know how capacity units you want to assign, please access the SAP BDC Capacity Unit Estimator (more guidance here). 

7. Click "Review". 

8. Click "Finish". 

9. See "Updating solution" message and wait for the updates to be finished.

entry.title: Unlocking Insights from Data Point Comments in SAP Analytics Cloud in QRC3.2025
entry.content:
Unlocking Insights from Data Point Comments in SAP Analytics Cloud in QRC3.2025

In today's fast-paced business environment, the ability to quickly and accurately interpret data is crucial. One often overlooked but highly valuable source of insight is data point comments - unstructured text input that capture context, rationale, and qualitative feedback. 

SAP Analytics Cloud provides standard users with the advanced AI-Assisted capability to improve the understanding of data point comments effectively and efficiently. This premium AI-Assisted capability enables users to

  • Summarize long-form comment to surface key insights at a glance
  • Aggregate the comments from descendant cells for a consolidated view
  • Summarize the discussions throughout the whole thread to capture key points
  • Support authoring of comments to save time and improve clarity

To learn more about this feature and value proposition, please see the AI Feature Catalog in the SAP Discovery Center and the feature help. 

Prerequisites:  Check that you have met all the necessary prerequisites, which includes activating the feature, which is detailed here.

 

Basics of AI-Assisted Commenting

To use AI-Assisted Commenting functionalities, users need to have the necessary prerequisites to view or update data point comment and the ‘Execute’ permission for the Generative AI object type.

This powerful capability offers several key functionalities:

Shortening and Simplifying Long Form Commentary: Lengthy comments can be overwhelming and time-consuming to read. This feature shortens and simplifies these comments into the language set in your user profile, making them more digestible and easier to understand. This feature can be triggered when a comment exceeds 500 characters.

Aggregating Comments from Descendant Cells: Data often comes with comments scattered across various descendant cells. This feature aggregates these comments in the language configured in your user profile, providing a consolidated view that saves time and reduces the risk of missing important information.

Summarizing discussions from the whole thread:  Comment threads often consist of comments from multiple users and evolve into discussions. This feature generates a summary of the entire thread, highlighting the key points.

Supporting User Authoring of Comments: When users are authoring their comments, AI can assist in refining the comment into a more professional and polished version.

Consistent experience across different commenting interfaces: The experience in the table widget and comment widget are consistent. 

  • Note: aggregating comment from descendent cells is only available in table widget as the table widgets show the hierarchical view.

Reusing Comment Summaries within a session: Comment summaries are shared within the same session, eliminating the need for repeated regeneration.

 

Explore With Examples

Assuming you are an English speaker, and your user profile language is set to English. 

Aggregating Comments from Descendant Cells

When comment columns are enabled in the table, you can aggregate comment from descendent cells - even if they were authored in various local languages by their respective owners. With just one click, AI-Assisted Commenting generates a summary of descendent cells’ comments into your language.

 

Shortening and Simplifying Long Form Commentary

Now, let's take a closer look at Low Calorie Beer. The comment here is quite detailed and lengthy - and written in Chinese, a language you may not understand.

With the help of the system, a summary is automatically generated and translates into your preferred language. This allows you to quickly grasp the key points and understand the content effortlessly

 

Aggregating comments from the whole thread

Now we move on to Amber. The comment thread here contains inputs added at different points in time, reflecting an on-going discussion. With a single click, you can summarize the entire thread to get a comprehensive overview of all the key points.

 

Supporting User Authoring of Comments

You enter your comment, and the system helps rephrase your text into a more professional and polished version, helping you communicate more clearly and effectively. You can then further edit the rephrased comment text or save it directly to the comment thread. 

Consistency between table widget and commenting widget

The same functionalities are also available in comment widget, ensuring a consistent experience across different commenting interfaces.

 

Reusing Comment Summaries within a session

Comment summaries are shared within the same session, eliminating the need for repeated regeneration.

For example, if a summary or aggregation has already been generated for the comments on Low Calories Beer and Red Wine, subsequent summary requests within the current session can directly show the summary without triggering additional AI service calls.

Note: once the user logs out or if other users initiate the requests, the summary or aggregation need to be regenerated again.

 

Conclusion

Overall, the AI-Assisted Commenting feature is a powerful addition to SAP Analytics Cloud, enhancing the way users interact with and understand their data. By simplifying comments, aggregating information, breaking down language barriers, and supporting user input, this tool significantly improves data comprehension and decision-making.

entry.title: はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - 共有方法
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズはSAP Analytics CloudのBI機能を使ってダッシュボードやレポートの作成を行う方を対象とし、SAP Analytics CloudのBIにおける基本の操作やTipsをハンズオン形式でご紹介します。

本ブログでは、モデルやストーリー、フォルダの共有方法についてご紹介いたします。

 

目次：

  • SAP Analytics Cloudにおける共有の概要
  • 共有方法[ハンズオン]
    • 公開フォルダへの格納
    • ファイルの共有
    • カタログへの公開

※ベースとなるサンプルストーリーの作成⼿順は、はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityでご紹介しています。
※ SAP Analytics Cloudは、四半期に１度のペースで製品のバージョンアップが実施されます。そのため今後のバージョンアップにより、本ブログで紹介する画⾯キャプチャや、操作が異なる可能性があることをご了承ください。（本ブログは2025年8⽉に作成しています。）

 

 

SAP Analytics Cloudにおける共有の概要

SAP Analytics Cloudでは、作成したストーリーやフォルダを共有することができます。ユースケースや共有範囲に応じて、以下の3つを使い分けて共有を行います。

①  公開フォルダへの格納
チームや組織単位で継続的に利用・更新されるコンテンツを一元管理する方法です。
公開フォルダは、テナントにアクセスできるすべてのユーザーが閲覧することができるため、社内で同一コンテンツを管理・更新する場合に適しており、フォルダ構造を整理することで運用効率も向上します。

②  共有フォルダの作成・ファイルの共有
特定のユーザーやチームに対して、個別のファイルやフォルダを直接共有する方法です。
アクセス権限を対象ごとに細かく設定できるため、一時的なレビューや限定的なコラボレーションに適しています。共有範囲を最小限に抑えたい場合や、プロジェクトごとに関係者が異なる場合に有効です。
フォルダやファイルごとにアクセス権限（閲覧、編集、フルコントロールなど）を設定することができます。

③  カタログへの公開
組織全体で広く利用してほしいコンテンツを、ポータル形式で発見・利用できるようにする方法です。
標準レポート、承認済みテンプレート、ガバナンスされたモデルなどをカタログに公開することで、誰でも容易に検索・参照できるようになります。社内全体でのストーリーの活用促進やナレッジ共有に有効で、コンテンツの発信手段として活用されます。
カタログはチーム単位での共有になります。

詳しくはHelp Portalもご参照ください：
ファイルまたはフォルダの共有
カタログへのコンテンツの公開および共有

 

 

共有方法[ハンズオン]

1. 公開フォルダへ格納しよう！

今回は「SAC BI blog」フォルダ内にある「S_SampleStory_Share」のストーリーを公開フォルダに格納します。

1.1.  左のサイドメニューから「ファイル」を選択し、格納したいファイルを選択します。

 

1.2.  「S_SampleStory_Share」を選択し、「フォルダアクション」から、「移動先...」を選択します。
※ストーリーを共有する際は、それに紐づくモデルも同時に共有するようにしてください。

 

1.3. 「公開」フォルダを選択し、「移動」をクリックします。
※「」マークがあるフォルダが共有フォルダになります。

 

 

 2. 作成したストーリーを共有しよう！

次に、特定のユーザー向けに作成したストーリーを公開します。今回は「SAC BI blog」フォルダ内にある「S_SampleStory_Share」のストーリーを格納します。

2.1. 左のサイドメニューから「ファイル」を選択し、格納したいファイルを選択します。「」マークをクリックし、「共有...」を選択します。
※ストーリーを共有する際は、それに紐づくモデルも同時に共有するようにしてください。

 

2.2 .  「ユーザーまたはチームの追加」から、共有したいユーザーもしくはチームを追加し、アクセス範囲を選択します。
「ユーザー定義...」を選択すると、細かいアクセス範囲の設定を行うことができます。

2.3. アクセス範囲が決まったら、「共有」を押します。「新しい受信者に電子メールを送信」にチェックを入れると、メールで通知することも可能です。
※同様にモデルやフォルダも共有することが可能です。

 

 

3. カタログに公開しよう！

次に、作成したストーリーをカタログに公開します。今回は「SAC BI blog」フォルダ内にある「S_SampleStory_Share」のストーリーを公開します。

3.1.  左のサイドメニューから「ファイル」を選択し、格納したいファイルを選択します。「」マークをクリックし、「カタログに公開...」を選択します。


3.2.  「チームの追加...」から、公開したいチームを追加します。「読み込みアクセス権を付与」を選択すると、選択されたチームのメンバーが公開されたフォルダを開くことができます。

3.3. （任意）ユーザーが見えるカタログの外見を編集することができます。
「詳細の編集...」を選択し、ストーリーのタイトルや説明、画像などを追加することができます。

カタログの外見はカードプレビューより確認することができます。

 

3.4.  「公開」をクリックすることでカタログを公開することができます。

 

今回はSACの共有方法のご紹介でした。SAP Analytics Cloudは他にも様々な表現や便利な機能があり、本ブログシリーズでご紹介しています。はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - シリーズまとめ - SAP Communityからご参照ください。

entry.title: How to use SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Analytics Cloud?
entry.content:
**Updated August 2025**

Welcome to our blog series focused on the SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC).

This guide provides a comprehensive, step-by-step approach to help you estimate the capacity units (CU) needed for your business case (before purchasing) or how you can distribute them across your solution components (after signing a contract) for SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) within SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC).

This post belongs to a blog series with 4 parts: 

  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator
  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Analytics Cloud (this post)
  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Datasphere (coming soon)
  • SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator for SAP Databricks (coming soon)

In SAC within BDC, the Capacity Units (CU) vary by license type and quantity of licenses. 

Following SAP Best Practices, two system types are recommended, one for each: 1) Test/QA and 2) Production.

1) For Test/QA, there is 1 SAC license type:

  • SAC Test:
    • It includes all SAC Planning Professional features but in a non-productive environment
    • Minimum requirement: 20 users to provision a test tenant, which refers to a minimum of 941 CU/Month (or 47.05 CU per user)

2) For production, there are 3 SAC license types:

  • SAC Business Intelligence (or SAC BI): 
    • It includes data exploration, visualization, and predictive analytics for insights and informed decision making. No planning features are available
    • Minimum requirement: 25 users to create a prod tenant (scenario 1), which refers to 640 CU/Month (or 25.60 CU per user)
  • SAC Planning Standard (or SAC Planning Std):
    • It includes basic planning functionalities with integrated predictive capabilities like running simulations, data input and scenario modelling
    • Minimum requirement: ⚠️  We can't provision a prod tenant only with Planning Std licenses; we need at least 10 Planning Std users and 1 Planning Prof user 
  • SAC Planning Professional (or SAC Planning Prof): 
    • It includes everything in Standard plus advanced planning capabilities, including building planning models, complex data actions, allocation rules, and detailed analysis and forecasting.
    • Minimum requirement: 10 Planning Std users and 1 Planning Prof user (scenario 2), which refers to 1548.93 CU/Month (72.85 CU per user for Planning Std and 820.43 CU per user for Planning Prof)

Below, you can find a summary table for the available licenses according each tenant type. 

Business TypesMinimum of licensesMinimum of CU
Test/QA20 SAC Planning Prof (=SAC Test)941 CU/Month
Production (Scenario 1)25 SAC BI640 CU/Month
Production (Scenario 2)1 SAC Planning Prof and 10 SAC Planning Std 1548.93 CU/Month

📌  Want to estimate more than the minimum? No problem! Below, you can find a step-by-step:

1. Open SAP Business Data Cloud Capacity Unit Estimator.

2. Select your "Hyperscaler" and "Data Center".

3. Click "Add" and double-click "SAP Analytics Cloud".

4. Enter the number of licenses for each SAC license type. In this example, we use 25 for SAC BI, 10 SAC Planning Std and 1 SAC Planning Prof. 

5. The final CU amount will appear in the top-right corner. 

Image 1

Image 2

👉  For details on provisioning SAC within BDC, please check out our dedicated blog post. 

💡  If you want to know more about the different SAC license types, read more here and here.

entry.title: はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - リンク付き分析
entry.content:
本ブログシリーズはSAP Analytics CloudのBI機能を使ってダッシュボードやレポートの作成を行う方を対象とし、SAP Analytics CloudのBIにおける基本の操作やTipsをハンズオン形式でご紹介します。

本ブログでは、ウィジェット間でフィルタや選択を同期させて、横断的に分析したい際にご使用いただけるリンク付き分析の作成についてご紹介いたします。

 

 

目次：

  • SAP Analytics Cloudにおけるリンク付き分析の概要
  • リンク付き分析の作成方法[ハンズオン]

※ベースとなるサンプルストーリーの作成⼿順は、はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityでご紹介しています。
※ SAP Analytics Cloudは、四半期に１度のペースで製品のバージョンアップが実施されます。そのため今後のバージョンアップにより、本ブログで紹介する画⾯キャプチャや、操作が異なる可能性があることをご了承ください。（本ブログは2025年8⽉に作成しています。）

 

 

SAP Analytics Cloudにおけるリンク付き分析の概要

リンク付き分析は、ストーリー内のあるウィジェット（チャート／テーブル／地図など）で行ったデータポイントの選択や階層ドリルの操作を、他のウィジェットにそのまま適応させる仕組みです。

ページ内の視点が揃い、関連するグラフやテーブルが同じ条件で一斉に切り替わるため、指標同士の関係を迷わず追えます。四半期ごとのKPIを横並びで比較したいとき、異常に見えるピークの原因を深掘りしたいときなどに便利です。

どのウィジェットを連動対象にするかは個別に指定でき、ストーリー/ページ内のすべてのウィジェットに適用したり、特定のウィジェットのみに適用するように設定もできます。

詳しくは SAP Help Portal も参照ください：リンク付き分析の設定 | SAP Help Portal

 

 

リンク付き分析の作成方法

0. はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - サンプルモデル／ストーリーの作成 - SAP Communityで作成したストーリーを編集モードで開こう！

0.1 ナビゲーションバーのファイルより作成したストーリーを開き、「編集」をクリックします。

 

1. リンク付き分析を作成しよう！

1.1.  事業セグメントごとの売上高のチャートにリンク付き分析を適用します。「…」マークから、「その他のオプション」、「リンク付き分析」、「設定」を開きます。
※ビルダパネルからも同様の設定をすることができます。

 

1.2. フィルタの適用範囲を設定します。「ページ上のすべてのウィジェット」を選択し、「データポイントの選択に応じてフィルタリング」にチェックを入れます。

「データポイントの選択に応じてフィルタリング」をオンにすると、ウィジェット上で特定のディメンションをクリックした時に、その条件が他のウィジェットにも自動で反映されます。
一方、この設定をオフにした場合は、リンク付き分析を設定したウィジェットに対してフィルタを適用するまでは、他のウィジェットにはフィルタがかかりません。

 

1.3. リンク付き分析を作成することができました。

「データポイントの選択に応じてフィルタリング」をオンにしたため、チャート上で「ベストITS」をクリックした時に、その条件が他のチャートにも自動で反映されているのがわかります。

 

今回はリンク付き分析のご紹介でした。SAP Analytics Cloudは他にも様々な表現や便利な機能があり、本ブログシリーズでご紹介しています。はじめてのSAP Analytics Cloud BI - シリーズまとめ - SAP Communityからご参照ください。

entry.title: SAP Analytics Cloud: Smarter Currency Conversion with Just Ask
entry.content:
When it comes to making data-driven decisions, numbers alone don’t always tell the full story, especially when you’re operating across markets, regions, or currencies. That’s why SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) makes it easy to bring currency intelligence into your conversations with just ask, our natural language-powered analytics feature. 

Whether you're analyzing revenue in local currencies or tracking global sales performance in EUR or USD, Just Ask helps you get the answers instantly and accurately. No complex scripting or data wrangling is required, just natural questions and smart insights 

Flexible Currency Options, Built for Real-World Business Needs 

Different teams have different reporting requirements; some need dynamic currency switching, while others rely on predefined conversions or local currencies by region. With SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Datasphere (DSP), you have a range of options to choose from depending on how your data is modeled. 

Below is a quick overview of the supported scenarios. After the table, we’ll walk you through each one with real-world context and guidance. 

How Just Ask Supports Currency Conversion with SAP Analytics Cloud Models vs. SAP Datasphere Models:

 

 

Conversion Category 

Conversion Type 

Just Ask on SAC Models 

Just Ask on DSP Models 

1 

Based on story-level calculation in SAC 

SAC story-level calculation based on model’s currency conversion  

✅Supported for basic (non-calculated) measures 

🗓️ Planned 

2 

Fixed-Measure Conversion as specified in model 

Predefined measures with hardcoded currency conversion applied at model level (e.g., Sales_EUR) 

✅Supported 

✅ Supported 

3 

Currency Dimension 

Target currency (currency concept on model-level) determined dynamically via a linked dimension (e.g., region or entity). Currency varies based on dimension member values. 

✅Supported 
🔄 Just Ask auto-adds currency dimension for breakdown 

⚠️Supported, but Just Ask does not auto-add the currency dimension 

4 

Currency as Model Variable 
(set by end user) 

Currency set via model variable; applies at query execution. Can be modified post-query in Just Ask. 

✅ Supported 

🔧 Variable can be updated interactively in Just Ask 

✅Supported 

🔧Variable can be updated interactively in Just Ask 

5 

Currency as Model Variable 
(included in end user’s query) 

Currency model as variable. End user is asking for it in natural language query (e.g., Sales in CAD).  

✅ Supported 

 ❌ Not supported 

 

Now, let’s explore each type in more detail: 

1. Story-level Calculation for Currency Conversion 

Best for: Fast ad hoc queries where users want to convert currencies without pre-built measures. 

With just ask, you can instantly convert currency values at runtime using the model’s built-in conversion logic. Simply ask a question like: 

“What were our 2024 sales in EUR?” 

Just ask pulls the latest conversion rates from the model’s currency table and returns values in your specified currency without any manual setup. 

Available for SAP Analytics Cloud Universal Models where currency conversion is enabled in the modeler. 

Requirements: 

  • The measure must be non-calculated 
  • The unit type must be defined as "currency" 

Behind the scenes: The booking date is used as the conversion reference, and if you paste the just ask result into your story, the converted measure is automatically created and saved.

Currently not supported for SAP Datasphere models, but support is planned in the future. 

 

2. Fixed Currency Measures 

Best for: Use cases where your model already contains hardcoded currency values. 

If your data model includes measures like Sales_EUR or Revenue_USD, you can easily query those in just ask with no extra steps needed. 

Fully supported in both SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Datasphere. 

These measures are typically created at the model level during data preparation and remain consistent across dashboards and stories. 

Think of this as a one-time setup option: once fixed currency measures are defined in your model, just ask treats each one like a standard metric with no extra configuration needed. 

 

3. Currency by Dimension 

Best for: Companies that operate across multiple regions and need to report in local currencies. 

Some organizations need to show currency values that align with specific regions or entities. With dimension-based currency measures, the appropriate currency is retrieved dynamically based on a linked dimension like country, business unit, or region. 

In SAP Analytics Cloud models, this is fully supported, and just ask automatically inserts the corresponding currency dimension to the result, making it easy to interpret values without mixing currencies in totals. 

In SAP Datasphere models, this functionality is supported, but just ask won’t auto-add the currency dimension. That means users must manually add the dimension via the Post Search builder panel or specify it in the query. 

Use this approach when reporting across multiple business units or local subsidiaries; your stakeholders will appreciate seeing values in their native currencies. 

 

4. Model Variable Currency 

Best for: Dashboards and queries where users need flexibility to switch currencies based on preference. 

Model variables offer dynamic control over currency selection. For example, users can switch between USD and EUR using a dropdown or prompt, without changing the structure of the query. 

Supported in both SAP Analytics Cloud and SAP Datasphere 

Just ask allows users to update the variable interactively through the data card, or it can be preset by default in Joule for seamless integration into more advanced workflows. 

 

5. Specifying Currency Variable in the Question 

Best for: Quick, natural language queries using variable-driven currency measure. 

In SAP Analytics Cloud, you can query a variable-driven currency measure and specify the target currency directly in your query. for example: 

“Show me SalesVar in CAD.” 

Just ask automatically parses the request, updates the target currency variable, and shows results accordingly. 

Supported only for SAP Analytics Cloud models. 

 

Built for Flexibility. Ready for Scale. 

Whether you’re a financial analyst tracking global revenue, a sales leader monitoring regional performance, or an operations manager comparing results across subsidiaries, currency conversion is essential to making confident, context-aware decisions. 

With just ask in SAP Analytics Cloud, you get a system that adapts to your business needs: 

  • Conversational queries that feel intuitive 
  • Multiple currency handling methods, from fixed to dynamic 
  • Smart defaults that prevent common errors like mixed currency aggregation 

 

Looking to do more? 

Just ask is even more powerful when paired with Analytical Insights in Joule, allowing you to bring AI-driven insights into your everyday workflow without leaving the tools you already use. 

Need help modeling currency for just ask in your SAP Analytics Cloud or SAP Datasphere environment? 
Check out our help documentation.

entry.title: SAP 分析云经典故事和分析应用停用后的下一阶段
entry.content:
正如博客《重要提醒：SAP Analytics Cloud 经典故事和分析应用的相关变动》所述，SAP 分析云一直致力于分阶段来引导客户迁移至优化体验。 

2025 年第三季度 QRC 的发布，标志着 SAP 分析云迈入全新阶段，也再次彰显我们在 Business Data Cloud（BDC）内始终如一地交付现代化、高性能且一致的用户体验的坚定承诺。 

 

现阶段有哪些变化？ 

在此阶段，用户将无法再新建经典故事或经典分析应用。 
例如，在“故事”模块中点击新建“画布”或“响应式页面”时，系统将直接启动优化故事体验，而不再弹出选择窗口询问“优化”还是“经典”。由此确保所有新增内容都能立即享受性能、易用性及功能上的全面提升。 

🔒新建经典故事与分析应用已被禁用 
✅现有经典（故事与分析应用）仍可继续编辑与全面维护 

 

现有经典故事和分析应用的持续可用 

尽管已禁止新建经典内容，您仍可继续维护现有的经典故事与分析应用。我们所说的“可维护”具体涵盖以下操作： 

  • 查看、编辑并保存内容 
  • 共享、复制及删除 

⚠️ 现有经典资产的访问权限将持续保留，直至 2026 年第二季度 QRC ，此后经典资产将全面停用； 
因此，请务必在该日期前完成向优化体验的迁移。 

 

文件库与对象管理的增强 

伴随本阶段更新，我们在资产呈现与管理方式上带来多项易用性改进： 

  1. 视觉区分：文件库现已为经典故事、经典分析应用与优化故事提供明显的视觉标识。 
  2. （已弃用）标签：所有已弃用的对象类型，其类型名称后均新增 “(已弃用)” 后缀。 
  3. 精细筛选：对象类型筛选器进一步细化，可分别过滤“经典故事（已弃用）”“分析应用（已弃用）”与“故事”。 

 

界面精简 


为了进一步简化用户体验，我们已移除所有指向已弃用资产的入口。具体调整如下： 

  1. 分析应用模块不再提供“创建”按钮，但仍会显示最近使用的分析应用。 
  2. 故事模块不再提供“智能发现”或“网格页面”作为可选项。 
  3. 点击“画布”“响应式页面”或“模板”后，将直接打开优化故事，而不再弹出“经典”与“优化”二选一的设计器提示。 
  4. 建模器模块已移除“兴趣点”标签页，无法再通过该入口新建兴趣点。 
  5. 从模型发起的新建画布或响应式页面操作，现统一跳转至优化故事。 

 

对设计者的提醒 


在经典体验（经典故事与分析应用）中，我们将原有的“停用警告”升级为更突出的“停用通知”。该提示以更突出的标识出现，以此提醒设计者经典资产将于 2026 年年中全面停用。此通知仅面向故事设计者显示（即仅在编辑页面中显示），确保他们第一时间获知并主导迁移。

 

为 2026 年全面停用做好准备 


本阶段是我们统一并现代化 SAP 分析云 体验之路上的重要里程碑。为避免您的业务受到影响，我们强烈建议所有客户在 2026 年第二季度 QRC 之前，将经典故事与分析应用迁移至优化体验。以下资源可助您一臂之力。 

1. 批量迁移工具 
自 2024 年第四季度 QRC 起，设计人员即可使用此工具一次性迁移最多 50 项资产。操作流程如下： 

  • 资产选择 
  • 转换检查与状态 
  • 转换设置 
  • 转换摘要 
    详情参阅博客《助力经典资产迈向优化体验：批量迁移工具介绍》。

 

2.系统管理员批量删除工具 
2025 年第二季度 QRC 起，在“系统概览 – Housekeeping”中，系统管理员可按最后访问日期一次性删除指定对象及其全部依赖对象，无需逐一手动删除，避免无用数据累积拖慢系统性能。 
详情参阅博客《新功能详解：使用Housekeeping在SAP 分析云系统中高效维护数据》。 

⚠️ 当前故事对象尚不支持区分经典与优化版本，该功能将在后续版本中提供。 

 

延伸阅读 

  • 重要提醒：SAP Analytics Cloud 经典故事和分析应用的相关变动 
  • 助力经典资产迈向优化体验：批量迁移工具介绍
  • SAP分析云中新的表构建体验
  • Optimized Experience Restrictions & Discontinued Features 
  • 新功能详解：使用Housekeeping在SAP 分析云系统中高效维护数据

原文链接：The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic E... - SAP Community

原作者：Tunir

entry.title: 2025 年第三季度 SAP 分析云“指南针”新功能亮点
entry.content:
在刚刚发布的 SAP 分析云 QRC3 版本中，指南针将上线两项新功能，进一步降低终端用户进行风险分析的难度。下面将为大家介绍这两个功能相对范围输入与冲突动因检测。

相对范围输入  

用户今后可将动因的不确定性以“相对值”形式录入，即以当前模型基线为参照设定偏移量。偏移量既可用百分比，也可用具体数值表示。在输入过程中，界面下方将同步显示对应的绝对值，便于即时核对。 

采用偏移量方式录入，一方面更贴合业务部门的表达习惯，便于准确捕捉假设；另一方面，同一影响幅度（如 +5%）可一键应用于多个动因，操作更加便捷。 

另有一项贴心设计：当方案发布时，系统会自动将用户输入的相对值转换为绝对值，若随后基于该结果创建私有副本，则这些数值将再次还原为相对范围，以兼顾结果浏览（公用方案）与方案建模（私有方案）的不同使用场景。 

冲突动因检测 

方案建模过程本身非常动态，用户通常需要以与思维同步的速度记录和建立各类假设。在此高速迭代过程中，极易因疏忽而产生相互冲突的动因设定，例如为存在重叠关系的动因同时赋予不确定性。典型情形是：在同一方案运行中，既为“欧洲营收”又为“德国营收”设定不确定性（德国隶属欧洲，二者存在层级重叠）。遇此情况，指南针将即时提示冲突，协助用户保持动因清单的精简、清晰与配置有效。 

通过上述两项全新功能，我们致力于进一步提升终端用户在方案建模过程中的效率，使业务人员能够更加轻松、直观地进行风险分析。 

如果您首次接触指南针功能，欢迎阅读以下博客，快速上手： 

  • 蒙特卡洛模拟入门
  • SAP 分析云指南针功能正式发布
  • SAP 分析云指南针分步详解（上）
  • SAP 分析云指南针分步详解（下）

 

原文作者：ChenNee

原文链接：https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/2025-q3-sap-analytics-cloud-compass-highlights/ba-p/14174928

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About the SAP Young Professionals Program
entry.content:
If you’re an ambitious graduate looking to launch your tech consulting career, the SAP Young Professionals program might be the opportunity you’ve been waiting for! This free, immersive training experience opens doors to become an SAP Associate Consultant and kick-start your career among SAP's. 

What is the SAP Young Professionals program?

It is a free, 2-3 month intensive training initiative from the SAP Digital Skills Center that aims to equip recent university graduates (with less than 3 years of graduation) with SAP knowledge, soft skills, and certifications that prepare them for SAP consulting-related position within the EMEA region. 

Graduates are trained in SAP technologies such as: SAP S/4HANA , SAP Analytics Cloud ,  Artificial Intelligence , SAP Business Technology Platform , within others ((Modules may vary by cohort or region).

Who is eligible for the program?

Applicants typically need to meet the following criteria.

  • Hold a university degree (Bachelor’s or higher). 
  • Be a recent graduate (within the past 3 years).
  • Be currently unemployed or underemployed
  • Show strong English proficiency.
  • Be citizens or legal residents of the country where the program is being offered.

Note: Specific requirements may vary depending on country and region.

What does the program include?

Over the course of 2–3 months, participants will:

  • Earn globally recognized certifications 
  • Gain access to SAP Learning Hub and be trained by SAP specialists 
  • Develop soft skills
  • Have the possibility of starting your career as Associate Consultant in SAP's ecosystem (partners + customers)

Is the program really free?

Yes. The SAP Digital Skills Center delivers this program at no cost to participants as part of SAP’s mission to close the digital skills gap and support sustainable employment. SAP invests in rising talent to help drive digital transformation across industries.

Is employment guaranteed after completing the program?

While job placement is not guaranteed, one of the key goals of YPP is to connect graduates with SAP partners and customers who are actively hiring. Many graduates secure employment within the SAP ecosystem shortly after completing the program. However, success depends on the graduate's performance, certification results, and engagement throughout the course.

How to apply?

Applications are submitted via 👉  SAP Digital Skills Center portal.

Keep an eye on the website or SAP’s social media channels for announcements about new program cohorts in your region.

Written by Valentina Guevara.

entry.title: The evolution of member ordering in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Introduction

This short blog post explains the old “Edit Member Order” for the Classic Table in the Optimized Design Experience (ODE), how it evolved into "Custom Order" with the New Table Build Experience in ODE proposed in the QRC3 2025, and what happens when you migrate Tables.

Ordering affects readability, storytelling, and how business users consume KPIs. Small UX changes here have big impact, so this is worth a quick, clear look.

 

“Edit Member Order” for [Measures] (in Optimized Design Experience – ODE)

In Classic Table (ODE), “Edit Member Order” is the manual-ordering capability used primarily for [Measures] (including calculated measures). It lets authors control the sequence of measure’s members at the same level so tables present KPIs in the exact order the business expects.

Default sorts (alphabetical, model order, or value-driven) don’t always match a narrative. Manual ordering lets you put priority metrics first, arrange measures in a business-friendly sequence, or mirror a report layout stakeholders expect.

To use it, the workflow is as follows:

  1. Open the story and switch to “Edit”;
  2. Select the table widget and open the “Builder Panel”;
  3. Locate the [Measures] you want to reorder in the Builder Panel. Click the “three-dot menu” on the measure dimension;
  4. Choose “Edit Member Order…”;
  5. In the Edit Member Order dialog, drag measures to the desired order. “Done” to apply.

 

“Custom Order” for [Measures] (ODE with New Table Build Experience)

The new approach. When switching to the New Table Build Experience (ODE), the manual ordering for [Measures] was redesigned.

The ordering control for dimension members now lives on the header region and is called “Custom Order”. This is separate from the Classic measure-centric “Edit Member Order” and is the natural, header-level experience for arranging rows or columns that come from a dimension. And It puts dimension ordering next to other column header-level actions:

  • Improve discoverability for row/column member ordering.
  • Consolidate table configuration for a clearer, more predictable authoring workflow.

To use it on [Measures], the workflow is now as follows:

  1. Open the story in Optimized Design Experience (ODE) and switch to “Edit”;
  2. Make sure you have activated the option “Switch All Tables To New Table Build Experience”;
  3. In the table widget, right-click the Measure header you want to reorder;
  4. Choose “Sort options” >> “Add Custom Order…” from the menu;
  5. In the “Create Custom Order” dialog, drag members into the desired sequence or use the movement controls. Create/save to update the table.

 

Migration behavior

Functionally, ordering controls were modernized and surfaced where they make the most sense in the New Table Build Experience.

When you migrate Classic Table to the New Table Build Experience in ODE:

  1. The “Edit Member Order option” is no longer available;
  2. Any previously defined Member Order on Measure is preserved and displayed as the default;
  3. If you want to change the default order, you can create one or multiple Custom Orders.

 

Demo

 

Conclusion

We modernized ordering so it’s more discoverable and aligned to the object type: measures order remain managed via the Builder Panel pattern in Classic Table, while all dimension members, including Measures in the New Table Build Experience are reordered from the table column’s header “Sort options >> Custom Order…”. And Converting Classic Table preserves your predefined orders as the default order.

 

Let us know what you think

We want this transition to be smooth and useful. Do not hesitate to share your feedbacks, it directly influences documentations and product improvements. Tell us:

  • Did your measure orders migrate as expected?
  • Any cases where dimension ordering behaved unexpectedly in the New Table Build Experience?

entry.title: Release Navigator for SAP BTP - What's New in Q3 2025
entry.content:
The Release Navigator for SAP BTP continues to evolve and expand, offering our customers improved resources and streamlined access to product updates.

With the Q3 2025 update, we ensured all content is up-to-date and we are excited to announce the addition of a new product page for SAP Customer Data Solutions as well as some cosmetic UI updates. Read more about the details in this blog post.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Collaborating closely with SAP BTP experts, we've expanded the release coverage by introducing 11 new product pages. These pages compile links to all available release information, such as schedules, pre- and post-release communications, blogs, and more:

  • SAP Customer Data Solutions, including
    • SAP Customer Data Cloud / SAP Customer Identity and Access Management
    • SAP Customer Data Platform

Read on to see what you can find on this new page.

SAP Customer Data Solutions

This page contains specific resources for SAP Customer Identity and Access Management, SAP Customer Data Platform, as well as release resources relevant across different SAP Customer Data Solutions. Here’s a list of all you can find on this page:

  • SAP Customer Identity and Access Management (CDC)
    • Roadmap Explorer: Upcoming Innovations
    • What’s New Viewer: Release Notes
    • Customer Influence Campaign
    • SAP Community Tag
  • SAP Customer Data Platform
    • Roadmap Explorer: Upcoming Innovations
    • What’s New Viewer: Release Notes
    • Customer Influence Campaign
    • SAP Community Tag
  • General Customer Data Solutions Resources
    • SAP BTP Newsletter
    • Enablement Webcasts
    • Subscription link to Cloud Availability Center

Please Note: This page has previously been available via the Release Navigator for Customer Experience. Adding this page to the Release Navigator for SAP BTP reflects the move of SAP Customer Data Solutions from the Customer Experience area to SAP BTP. The page in the Release Navigator for Customer Experience will stay online until the beginning of Q4 2025 for everyone to take note and switch out their potential bookmarks or saved links. After that, only the page within the Release Navigator for SAP BTP will remain available.

Check it out.

 

 

With this last round of updates, we added new visual elements to all release navigators. The UI updates in the Release Navigator for SAP BTP do not affect functionality or performance and are strictly cosmetical.

On the home page also known as the Product Specific page, you will notice that our Welcome and Release Calendar cards have received a facelift for a fresher look and feel. 

On all pages where you can open informational text boxes by hovering over the lightbulb icon, you will see a slight update to the design of these boxes. Content and functionality remain the same. 

As a reminder: These pop-up boxes show up on every page with a lightbulb icon at the top and may be moved around on the page or closed once you are done reading them.

 

 

For centralized information regarding the release of new features for SAP BTP products and services, consult the Consolidated Release Schedule for SAP BTP.

Regarding the Release Navigator updates, refer to this update plan:

*Disclaimer: The schedule is subject to alterations without notice, including potential delays or the integration of changes in subsequent update windows. It doesn't establish a commitment, promise, or legal duty to deliver any material, code, or functionality. Looking into the remaining quarters of 2025, updates will focus on quarterly content maintenance and a steady extension of product coverage. No substantial UI updates are planned for the time being.

 

 

The Readiness@Scale team within SAP Enterprise Support is driven to ensure release readiness across the SAP Enterprise Support portfolio. Our mission is to empower SAP customers to effectively adopt and utilize innovations.

If you have feedback or specific requests for content within the release navigator, feel free to contact us.

Don't forget to explore our team’s blogs tagged under Readiness@Scale.

Happy navigating!

Readiness@Scale  
SAP Enterprise Support

entry.title: UPDATE: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud Availability via SAP Business Data Cloud
entry.content:
After the announcement on July 1st regarding the availability of SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud (public option) via SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC), the reaction was of great excitement and interest in learning more about the next steps especially about the tenant rewiring option to move existing tenants to SAP BDC. If you missed the announcement, you could read it here: Announcement: SAP Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud - SAP Community

The objective of this blog is to share with you the latest information about the tenant rewiring and what it involves.

First, what does it mean for an SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud to be rewired?

A tenant rewiring does not mean artefacts or data migration, it mainly refers to the consumption approach (from a commercial model perspective) of these services, and to the customer facing tool to manage the tenant lifecycles (via SAP for Me).  The tenant itself will remain the same, and the URL of the current tenants will not change either. In addition, there are no additional charges for rewiring an SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud tenant to SAP BDC.

Second, how will the tenant rewiring work?

There are two paths for customers when it comes to how the tenant rewiring will work.

Customers may have started their consumption of SAP Datasphere or SAP Analytics Cloud (public option) via one of the following consumption models:

  • A subscription of the services where the tenants are provisioned and managed by SAP
  • A subscription of the services where the tenants are provisioned self-service by customers via the customers SAP BTP Global Accounts.

The tenant rewiring tool will support both models; however, the way the process is triggered will be different.

For the SAP-managed / provisioned tenants, the tenant rewiring will be initiated automatically as soon as you update your subscription with SAP (via your SAP account team) to move your subscription from the standalone product subscription to the SAP BDC subscription. This means that the tenant rewiring will be initiated as part of your subscription change request, and the tenant will automatically move to SAP BDC.

When you have a new subscription to SAP BDC, you will receive an email notification from SAP to log into your SAP for Me account. You will need to activate your BDC cockpit in your appropriate data center. If these steps are done prior to the tenant rewiring process, you will be able to see the rewired tenants in your BDC formation as soon as the process is completed.

NOTE: You must use the same hyperscaler and the same data center for your BDC cockpit as your current standalone subscription. The tenant rewiring tool does not migrate tenants between hyperscalers or data centers.

It is important to mention that the tenant will be available for your end users during the process and there is no tenant downtime required by the tenant rewiring tool.

For the tenants that are provisioned self-service via the customers SAP BTP Global Account, your admin will be able to initiate the tenant rewiring directly via the BTP Global Account, also self-service. The only pre-condition required is that a BDC subscription must pre-exist before triggering the tenant rewiring process to move the tenant to SAP BDC.

The steps are as follows:

  • BTP Admin goes in the BTP Global Account / BTP cockpit and updates the BTP Service instance related to the tenant
  • The request is received by SAP and the process is initiated to update the tenant and move it to BDC
  • Login to SAP for Me and, login to BDC, go to the resources tab where you will be able to find the rewired tenants under “bdc-rewired” resource group.
  • Once the rewiring is completed, the tenant will be visible in BDC

Overall, the tenants are preserved and now will be consumed via SAP BDC.

For more information and step-by-step, visit the tenant rewiring documentation.

SAP Analytics Cloud in this blog refers to the following:

  • SAP Analytics Cloud for business intelligence, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud for planning, standard edition, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud for planning, professional edition, public system option
  • SAP Analytics Cloud, test tenant, public system option

entry.title: Introducing the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt 🔨🪙 ... COMING SOON
entry.content:
Welcome to the Devtoberfest Scavenger Hunt, a chase around important SAP developer-related tools/sites, a challenge to construct a secret phrase, and a chance to win 1000s of points toward the Devtoberfest grand prize.

The hunt officially starts Sept. 25, with the release of the first clue during that day's SAP Developer News, and you have until the end of Devtoberfest, Oct. 24, to complete it.

To get all the clues make sure to SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

Learn more about the  entire Devtoberfest event in @KevinR's post Devtoberfest 2025 Welcome!.

What you need to find

We have hidden a special phrase, which you need to figure out using the clues in the next section. Along your journey you will do the following:

  1. Visit about 10 different locations related to SAP developers, mostly web sites that are designed to help you in your daily SAP development.
  2. At each location, you will discover a set of hexadecimal digits.
  3. Concatenate the digits together (in the order of the missions) to get one, 37-digit hexadecimal number.
  4. Multiply that hexadecimal number by another secret number, for which we will give a clue.
  5. Take the resulting 38-digit hexadecimal product, and convert it into the secret phrase, using each pair of digits as ASCII characters.
  6. Enter the phrase, exactly (case-sensitive, no extra spaces), into the Scavenger Hunt tutorial.‌

Not until the SAP Developer News of Oct. 16 will you have all the pieces to be able to complete the phrase. 

Example Mission

As an example of what you will have to do, here's a short sample mission (just a warm-up, no points will be earned).

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
17

SAP Developers YouTube Channel

Go to our SAP Developer YouTube channel. 

Open @Rekha_DR's video "SAP Build Process Automation (Part 1): Build your very first process". Watch it and find the secret 7-digit hexadecimal number in one of the info cards.

26SAP Community

Use the Developer Tools on your browser to inspect the words "SAP Community" in the previous column and find the 6-digit ASCII code for the color of the text.

 

3None (directly) 

Concatenate the 2 sets of hexadecimal digits, in order, and multiply the resulting hexadecimal number by the number of original SAP founders (you can easily find the number on the SAP Wikipedia page).

Convert the resulting hexadecimal number into a phrase, converting each pair of digits into a character using ASCII codes.

👉Post a comment/picture about the phrase -- but NOT the phrase itself  (like your experiences with or opinion about the phrase, or a picture of something belonging to you that reminds you of the phrase) -- you won't get any points, but it will be fun and you will be ready for the real scavenger hunt. If you have any trouble with this example mission, post in the comments.

REMINDER: The above is just an example of how the real scavenger hunt will work. The real scavenger hunt instructions will be described in the rest of this blog post, as clues become available.

 

The (real) mission

Below are the instructions for finding the hexadecimal digits for the actual scavenger hunt. We will release clues as follows:

  • In the SAP Developer News of Sept. 25, Oct. 2, Oct. 9, and Oct. 16.
  • In this blog each Monday during the first 3 weeks of Devtoberfest.

👉To be notified when a new clue is released, SUBSCRIBE TO THIS POST!!

‌ When you find the secret phase, just enter it into this Devtoberfest tutorial.

To guide you, we have created a second tutorial -- you do not have to use it, nor do you get any points from it. But you can enter the 1 to 6 digits from each mission to check if you received the correct digits for that mission.

Here are your missions:

 

MissionNo. DigitsSAP Web PropertyInstructions
12

SAP Developer News

The Developer News comes out each Thursday with the latest about ABAP, CAP, BTP, SAP Build, UI5, Fiori, AI, and all your favorite SAP developer topics. All delivered by some of your favorite Developer Advocates, like DJ, Shilpa Shankar, Thomas Jung, Antonio Maradiaga, Nora von Thenen and the rest of the gang.

Most episodes about 5 minutes. Also available as a Podcast.

Watch the Developer News of Sept. 25
26 To be released Sept. 29
34 To be released Sept. 29
42 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 2
54 To be released Oct. 6
66 To be released Oct. 6
76 Watch the Developer News of Oct. 9
86 To be released Oct. 13
91 To be released Oct. 13
10None (directly) Watch the Developer News of Oct. 16

Good luck!

😸

entry.title: Guide for Inline Translations of Embedded SAC Stories in SAP Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM
entry.content:
Embedded SAC stories in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM include a useful feature called Inline Translation. This feature allows customers to create and manage translations for story-related metadata during story creation or editing.

Inline Translation vs. Metadata Translation vs. Data Translation

It’s easy to mix up these three terms, so here’s a simple breakdown:

  • Inline Translation
    Refers to metadata created within an Embedded SAC Story. Examples include the story title, description, page titles, and widget titles. In short, anything you create inside the Embedded SAC environment.
  • Metadata Translation
    Applies to the metadata of Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM—for example, the titles of data sources and their fields. This feature is not yet supported but will be available soon.
  • Data Translation
    Refers to translations of actual business data, such as code descriptions and extension code lists, in Sales & Service Cloud V2 and SAP ESM. This is already supported.

How to Enable Inline Translation

Enabling Inline Translation is a two-step process. Please note that this needs to be done for each story individually.

Step 1: Enable Translation for a Story

This is a one-time setup per story.

  1. Go to All Settings → Analytics → Design Stories.
  2. Select the story you want to translate and click Edit.
  3. In edit mode, click the gear icon under the File section, then select Story Details.
  4. In the pop-up window, turn on the Enable Translation toggle and click Save.
  5. After the pop-up closes, save the story again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Important: The language you are logged in with becomes the source language for that story. This cannot be changed later. Make sure you log in with the correct language before enabling translations.

Step 2: Maintain Translations for Target Languages

This step must be repeated for every target language you want to support.

  1. Open the Embedded SAC story in Edit mode.
  2. From the menu, select Tools → Inline Translation (or More → Tools → Inline Translation).
  3. In the pop-up, choose the Target Language from the dropdown list.
  4. Update the text fields with the translated content. The source language text will appear by default.
  5. Click Done, then save the story.

 

 

 

 

 

 

What Business Users Will See

Once translations are maintained, your business users will automatically see story texts in the language they use to log in to Sales & Service Cloud V2 or SAP ESM.
